channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HADOOP-18912] upgrade snappy-java to 1.1.10.4 due to CVE
item.description:
follow up to HADOOP-18782

https://github.com/xerial/snappy-java/security/advisories/GHSA-55g7-9cwv-5qfv
item.summary: upgrade snappy-java to 1.1.10.4 due to CVE

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

HADOOP-18912

      1. Description of PR
      1. How was this patch tested?
      1. For code changes:
  • [ ] Does the title or this PR starts with the corresponding JIRA issue id (e.g. 'HADOOP-17799. Your PR title ...')?

rohit-kb commented on PR #6115:
URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/6115#issuecomment-1752725247

Thanks @pjfanning for working on this, I have cherry-picked this change to branch-3.3. As per Steve, the change has to go through branch-3.3 before being ported downstream.

pjfanning commented on PR #6115:
URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/6115#issuecomment-1752730578

@rohit-kb thanks for the PR. I'm stepping back from 3.3 backports. All the 3.3 builds fail because of issues with module-info.class files leaking into the hadoop fat jars like hadoop-client-runtime and hadoop-client-minicluster

rohit-kb commented on PR #6115:
URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/6115#issuecomment-1752765285

Yes, I did face similar issues in some of the PRs. Just a hunch but I think porting HADOOP-18131(https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-18131) to branch-3.3 might help. I was in the middle of doing that, however, there were some complexities that I wasn't aware of. Will try to port it again.
